meanings.definition: A compound containing two amino groups.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied a diamine in the lab.
meanings.sent2: Diamine is commonly used in the production of certain plastics.
meanings.sent3: Why did the two amino groups go to the party together? Because they were a diamine duo!
meanings.sent4: The diamine compound acted like a bridge connecting the two parts of the molecule.
meanings.sent5: The diamine structure resembled a tiny ladder with two amino rungs.

meanings.definition: A type of chemical compound with two nitrogen atoms.
meanings.sent1: The diamine molecule has two nitrogen atoms bonded together.
meanings.sent2: Chemists use diamine in various industrial processes.
meanings.sent3: The two nitrogen atoms in the diamine were best friends, always sticking together.
meanings.sent4: The diamine compound was like a nitrogen double-decker bus, carrying two atoms at once.
meanings.sent5: The diamine compound sparkled under the microscope, revealing its dual nitrogen structure.
